Laura State

Hi! Thanks for visiting my website.

I am Laura State, currently a Marie Sk≈Çodowska-Curie Early Stage Researcher with the NoBIAS ITN and a PhD student in Data Science. I am based in the KDD Lab at the University of Pisa, Italy. My PhD supervisors are Salvatore Ruggieri and Franco Turini.

I want to contribute to a better understanding of machine learning models. Specifically, I am interested in the social implications of those systems, and long-term consequences. I am currently focussing on developing and improving explanation techniques for machine learning models that are not interpretable. To this end, I am heavily drawing from formal logic.

I hold a B.Sc. in Physics and a M.Sc. in Neural Information Processing. Further, I have done two internships in the micro-finance industry, working on data analytics.

I am also interested in feminist theory, and making scientific research accessible for a broader public.

For more details, click on CV or publications.

Feel free to contact me via email or on linkedin.
